definition: "speech" or "words" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 149)/see also 言字旁[yan2 zi4 pang2]
surname Wu/area comprising southern Jiangsu, northern Zhejiang and Shanghai/name of states in Southern China at different historical periods
lapse/mistake/to make a mistake/fault/service fault (in volleyball, tennis etc)
to delay/to hold up/to waste time/to interfere with
to delay/to be held up/to miss (an opportunity)/delay/holdup
mistaken ideas/misconceptions/the error of one's ways
to misjudge/error of judgment/incorrect ruling/miscarriage of justice
to affect adversely/to delay or hinder/to waste (an opportunity)/to mislead
to take a wrong step in life (idiom)/to go astray

sentences.english: They started out early so that they would not miss the train.
sentences.chinese: 他们早早出发是为了不误火车。

sentences.english: Quicken work, safety education does not relax.
sentences.chinese: 磨刀不误砍柴功，安全教育不放松。

sentences.english: I am extremely sorry about the delay.
She put salt in her cup of tea by mistake.
sentences.chinese: 她误把盐放进装着茶的杯子里。

sentences.english: Don't ask the examiner if what you say is correct。
sentences.chinese: 不要询问考官你回答的是否正确误。

sentences.english: He came so late that he missed the class.
sentences.chinese: 他来得如此晚，以致于误了一节课。

sentences.english: The one missent must be first attended to; it had been written five days ago.
sentences.chinese: 误投过的那封信当然要先读，那还是五天前写的。

sentences.english: Did you plug them into the line-in jack by mistake?
sentences.chinese: 未插入它们中的行的插孔误？

sentences.english: UFOs reports were most likely to be misidentified street lamps.
sentences.chinese: 大多数情况都是市民误把街灯之类的认做UFO。

sentences.english: When Philip miss the last bus, he was at a loss to know what to do.
sentences.chinese: 当菲利浦误了最后一班公共汽车，茫然不知该怎么办。

sentences.english: All users suspended wrongly will be unsuspended.
sentences.chinese: 暂停所有用户误将恢复正常运作。

sentences.english: My letter to mother must have been miscarried , for she never received it.
sentences.chinese: 我寄给母亲的信一定是误投了，因为她一直没有收到。

sentences.english: But later, people miswrote the name.
sentences.chinese: 后来人们误把苟杳这个名字。
勿逞一时之快，误美好一生。

sentences.english: Prayers and provender hinder no journey.
Hurry up, or you will miss the last bus.
sentences.chinese: 快点儿，否则你将误了最后一班车了。

definition: to think (i.e. to take it to be true that ...) (Usually there is an implication that the notion is mistaken – except when expressing one's own current opinion.)
to obscure/to confuse/to mix up/to blur/to mislead
to falsely believe/to be mislead/to fall for (a trick etc)
to doubt (sth)/to be skeptical of/to have one's doubts/to harbor suspicions/to suspect that
to err/to get sth wrong/to miscalculate/to misunderstand
to take sth to be true
to consider as/to take to be
